skill.name: chatgpt-app-builder
skill.description:
Build ChatGPT Apps using the Apps SDK and MCP. Use when users want to:
(1) Evaluate if their product should become a ChatGPT App
(2) Design and implement MCP servers with widgets
(3) Test apps locally and in ChatGPT
(4) Prepare for App Store submission
Triggers: "ChatGPT app", "Apps SDK", "build for ChatGPT",
"ChatGPT integration", "MCP server for ChatGPT", "submit to ChatGPT"

security_audit.summary: This is a development framework skill for building ChatGPT Apps. The code includes legitimate MCP server implementation, API client, and React widget. Network and filesystem access are standard for server-side applications. Security patterns are well-documented including XSS prevention, SSRF protection, and rate limiting.

low_findings.title: Environment variable access for API configuration
low_findings.description: The API client reads environment variables (API_BASE_URL, API_TOKEN) at runtime. This is standard practice for configuration but could expose credentials if improperly set. The skill uses placeholders by default (API_TOKEN is empty string) and relies on user configuration.

low_findings.title: Image proxy fetches external URLs
low_findings.description: The image proxy fetches external images from whitelisted domains to convert them to data URLs for CSP compliance. While domain whitelist and SSRF protection are implemented, the feature allows outbound HTTP requests from the server.

low_findings.title: CORS allows wildcard in development
low_findings.description: The MCP server sets Access-Control-Allow-Origin: "*" for SSE connections and POST messages. This is documented as development-only behavior and production deployments should configure specific origins per security documentation.

content.user_title: Build ChatGPT Apps with Apps SDK
content.value_statement: Building ChatGPT Apps requires understanding the Apps SDK, MCP protocol, and widget development. This skill provides a complete development framework with best practices, security patterns, and deployment guidance to create production-ready apps.
actual_capabilities: Guide through 5-phase development workflow from concept to App Store
Apply Know/Do/Show framework to evaluate product fit for ChatGPT Apps
Generate MCP server with SSE transport and tool definitions
Build React widgets with Apps SDK hooks and state management
Implement security patterns: XSS prevention, SSRF protection, rate limiting
Test locally with MCP Inspector and ngrok tunnel before deployment
limitations: Requires Node.js 18+ and npm for local development
Users need their own backend API to integrate with ChatGPT
Production deployment requires external hosting (Fly.io, Vercel, etc.)
OAuth integration requires separate well-known endpoint setup

use_cases.title: Evaluate product fit
use_cases.description: Determine if a product should become a ChatGPT App using the Know/Do/Show framework and golden prompt testing

use_cases.title: Implement MCP server
use_cases.description: Build a complete MCP server with tools, React widgets, and security patterns using TypeScript and React

use_cases.title: Deploy to production
use_cases.description: Configure CI/CD pipelines, Docker deployment, and prepare apps for ChatGPT App Store submission

prompt_templates.title: Check product fit
prompt_templates.scenario: Evaluating if a product should become a ChatGPT App
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Know/Do/Show framework to evaluate if [product name] should become a ChatGPT App. Ask me about the product data, user actions, and UI requirements needed.

prompt_templates.title: Design app tools
prompt_templates.scenario: Designing tool definitions for an MCP server
prompt_templates.prompt: Design 3-5 MCP tool definitions for a [product name] ChatGPT App. Use the service_verb_noun naming convention and include readOnlyHint, destructiveHint, and openWorldHint annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Build widget UI
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a React widget with Apps SDK
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React widget that displays [data type] using the Apps SDK. Include useOpenAI, useToolOutput, and useWidgetState hooks. Implement filter tabs and item selection.

prompt_templates.title: Add security patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Add security patterns to my ChatGPT App including: XSS prevention for API responses, SSRF protection for image proxy, rate limiting per session, and CORS configuration for ChatGPT domains.

output_examples.input: Help me build a ChatGPT App for my task management product
output: Phase 1: Fit Evaluation - Ask about data types, user actions, and UI needs
Phase 2: Design - Define tools like taskflow_get_tasks, taskflow_create_task
Phase 3: Implementation - Generate MCP server and React widget
Phase 4: Testing - Test with MCP Inspector and ngrok
Phase 5: Deployment - Deploy to Fly.io and submit to App Store

best_practices: Use one tool per function: get_*, list_*, create_*, update_*, delete_* with clear descriptions
Separate structuredContent (for model) from _meta (for widget-only data) in responses
Implement idempotency keys for mutation tools to prevent duplicate operations on retries
Add confirmation receipts after mutations to show exactly what changed and build user trust
anti_patterns: Combining read and write operations in a single tool violates the one-job-per-tool principle
Returning sensitive data in structuredContent exposes it to the model - use _meta instead
Skipping rate limiting allows abuse and can exhaust server resources
Using wildcards in CORS configuration or domain whitelists creates security vulnerabilities

faq.question: What is the minimum Node.js version required?
faq.answer: Node.js 18.0.0 or higher is required. The MCP SDK and modern TypeScript features need ES2020 support.

faq.question: How many tools can a ChatGPT App have?
faq.answer: Apps typically have 2-5 tools. Each tool should have one clear purpose. Too many tools make it harder for the model to select correctly.

faq.question: Can I use any frontend framework for widgets?
faq.answer: Yes, but the widget bundle must be self-contained. The build script uses esbuild to bundle React into a single file. Frameworks like Vue or Svelte work if they can be bundled similarly.

faq.question: Is user data sent to OpenAI?
faq.answer: No. ChatGPT Apps use MCP to communicate directly between ChatGPT and your server. OpenAI only sees the conversation, not your API data. Your server handles all authentication and data access.

faq.question: Why is my widget not rendering?
faq.answer: Common causes: Widget bundle not built (run npm run build), invalid session routing, missing MIME type, or CORS blocking ChatGPT domains. Check browser console and server logs for errors.

faq.question: How is this different from a regular MCP server?
faq.answer: ChatGPT Apps require SSE transport for streaming, widget support with Apps SDK UI, specific response structures (content, structuredContent, _meta), and compliance with App Store policies including security headers.
